title: Epynt Way Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Graham Horn / On the Epynt Way
images.caption: On the Epynt Way. A bit wet in places, but generally an excellent path along the north-western scarp of the Mynydd Epynt, legitimately just within the army training area.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Epynt Way marker #625
images.caption: Epynt Way marker #625. While travelling anticlockwise around the ascending numbered marker posts, don't forget to look behind you occasionally. At the top of this ascent you get a great view of the Bannau (pictured) or even the Brecon Beacons.

images.title: Graham Horn / On the Epynt Way
images.caption: Trail and country view.

images.title: Graham Horn / From the Epynt Way
images.caption: There are extensive sheep grazing in the area.

images.title: Graham Horn / Towards The Drovers Arms
images.caption: Towards The Drovers Arms. This military road heads west towards an isolated former pub called the Drovers Arms.

images.title: Graham Horn / Mabioin Way monument
images.caption: Mabioin Way monument. This was constructed in 1973 to mark the completion of the Mabioin Way (the army training area perimeter road) by the Royal Engineers

images.title: Graham Horn / On the Epynt Way
images.caption: Here is one of the information boards as the way crosses the Cilieni and low lying sheep pasture.

images.title: Graham Horn / Bridleway to Brestbaily
images.caption: Bridleway to Brestbaily. This bridleway runs from the military area, parallel to the Vsgir Fawr to the farm of Brestbaily.

description: A circular cycling and walking route on lanes and bridleways within the boundary of the MOD's busy Sennybridge Army Training Area. The establishment of the Epynt Way, has gone some way to compensating for the reduction in public access across this attractive area by the MOD. The village of Llangammarch Wells with its railway station makes a good access point for the route. On the way there are lovely views towards Mynydd Epynt and the Brecon Beacons. The route is waymarked with a disc featuring a white horse.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south west of the trail there's a nice circular trail around Usk Reservoir to try. Near here there's also the the market town of Llandovery where you can visit the ruined 13th century castle and enjoy footpaths along the River Towy. The town of Builth Wells is close to the eastern side of the route. The epic Wye Valley Walk can be picked up here.

display_address: B4519, Upper Chapel, Merthyr Cynog, Powys, Cymru / Wales, LD3 9RG, United Kingdom
